abstracts.cdata!:
The project will finance priority
            investments of the GoPunjab (Government of Punjab) urban
            development program and will comprise three groups of
            components. In Lahore the upgrading of local urban services
            and cultural asset conservation within the walled city. As
            well as city wide incremental investments to improve,
            rehabilitate and extend water supply, sewerage, stormwater
            drainage and road maintenance, along with improvements to
            road safety, traffic and the bus services. For the three
            intermediate Punjab cities of Gujranwala, Sialkot and
            Multan, the upgrading of local urban services and related
            infrastructure and investment studies will be carried out.
            Also financed will be training and technical assistance for
            improvements in the municipal finance and property tax
            systems, sector institution training, base mapping, and
            preparation of future investments in the Punjab cities.
